qas.question: How did the KPA hurt the Republic of Korea's intellectual core?

answers.text: by killing civil servants and intellectuals

qas.question: Who was held responsible for the actions of the KPA?
Where did the Eighth United States and ROK get pushed back to?
What body of water provided a natural border to the UN command-controlled Pusan perimeter?
How much of Korea was under the control of the United Nations?

context: By August, the KPA had pushed back the ROK Army and the Eighth United States Army to the vicinity of Pusan in <a2_0>southeast Korea<a2_0/>. In their southward advance, the KPA purged the Republic of Korea's intelligentsia <a0_0>by killing civil servants and intellectuals<a0_0/>. On 20 August, General MacArthur warned North Korean leader <a1_0>Kim Il-sung<a1_0/> that he was responsible for the KPA's atrocities. By September, the UN Command controlled the Pusan perimeter, enclosing about <a4_0>10%<a4_0/> of Korea, in a line partially defined by the <a3_0>Nakdong River<a3_0/>.
